description:
cmd/6l: Fixes for 64-bit Plan 9

Plan 9 versions for amd64 have 2 megabyte pages.
This also fixes the logic for 32-bit vs 64-bit Plan 9,
making 64-bit the default, and adds logic to generate
a symbols table.

messages.text:
PTAL.

Added generation of symbols table
and updated CL description.

On 2012/05/17 18:42:25, akumar wrote:
> Hello mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com, mailto:rsc@golang.org, mailto:rminnich@gmail.com,
> mailto:ality@pbrane.org (cc: mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com, mailto:john@jfloren.net),
> 
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, rsc@golang.org, rminnich@gmail.com, ality@pbrane.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com, john@jfloren.net),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

I've tried on my local Plan 9 64-bit CPU server and the
result seems satisfactory.

LGTM

-- 
David du Colombier
Seems fine, but I'd like to hear from someone else running Plan 9.

David du Colombier <0intro@gmail.com> once said:
> I've tried on my local Plan 9 64-bit CPU server and the
> result seems satisfactory.

Where is the amd64 Plan 9 kernel?
Do you mean Nix?

This change looks reasonable to me.

  Anthony

Nix is the kernel, yes.

On 22 May 2012 17:15, Anthony Martin <ality@pbrane.org> wrote:
> David du Colombier <0intro@gmail.com> once said:
>> I've tried on my local Plan 9 64-bit CPU server and the
>> result seems satisfactory.
>
> Where is the amd64 Plan 9 kernel?
> Do you mean Nix?
>
> This change looks reasonable to me.
>
>  Anthony

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=8f943ca19eb2 ***

cmd/6l: Fixes for 64-bit Plan 9

Plan 9 versions for amd64 have 2 megabyte pages.
This also fixes the logic for 32-bit vs 64-bit Plan 9,
making 64-bit the default, and adds logic to generate
a symbols table.

R=golang-dev, rsc, rminnich, ality, 0intro
CC=golang-dev, john
